question: [File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_local_timeout()] [Sync Only Broadcast] At lines 999-1003, sync_only mode broadcasts sync_info instead of timeout - can this be exploited to prevent timeout certificate formation? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_local_timeout()] [Round Timeout Signature] At lines 1010-1022, TwoChainTimeout is signed by safety_rules - can signature failures during timeout leave the validator in an inconsistent state? (High)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_local_timeout()] [Timeout Reason Leakage] At line 1024, compute_timeout_reason() provides detailed information - does this leak validator state that could help attackers? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_local_timeout()] [NIL Vote Generation] At lines 1046-1063, NIL blocks are generated for timeouts - can an attacker force validators to vote for NIL repeatedly to waste voting power? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_local_timeout()] [Timeout Vote Addition] At lines 1065-1078, timeout is added to an existing vote - can this modification bypass safety rules checks? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_local_timeout()] [Vote Recording Race] At line 1080, vote is recorded to round_state before broadcasting - can broadcast failures leave inconsistent state where vote is recorded but not sent? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_certificates()] [New Round Race] At lines 1097-1101, if process_certificates() returns a new_round_event, it's immediately processed - can concurrent certificate processing cause multiple new_round_events? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_certificates()] [Certificate Validation] The sync_info from block_store is trusted at line 1095 - can inconsistent block_store state cause invalid certificates to trigger round changes? (High)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Author Extraction] At lines 1113-1115, proposal.author() is unwrapped with expect() - what if author is None despite verification? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Vtxn Feature Bypass] At lines 1117-1125, ProposalExt is rejected if vtxn_config is disabled - can this check be bypassed by manipulating the config state? (High)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Vtxn Verification Loop] At lines 1127-1138, validator txns are verified in a loop - can one invalid vtxn prevent processing of the entire proposal, or can attackers craft proposals with just-barely invalid vtxns to waste resources? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Vtxn Count Integer Overflow] At lines 1140-1148, (count_acc + 1, size_acc + txn.size_in_bytes()) accumulates - can integer overflow occur if malicious vtxns report u64::MAX size? (High)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Vtxn Limit Enforcement] At lines 1167-1178, vtxn count and bytes are checked against limits - are these limits enforced consistently across all validators, or can limit divergence cause consensus failures? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Payload Size Overflow] At lines 1181-1194, payload_len + vtxn count is checked against max_receiving_block_txns - can this addition overflow? (High)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Proposer Election Validation] At lines 1196-1201, is_valid_proposal() checks proposer and detects duplicates - can this be bypassed by carefully timing proposals at epoch boundaries? (Critical)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Denied Transaction Check] At lines 1205-1215, check_denied_inline_transactions() filters denied txns - can an attacker bypass this by manipulating block_txn_filter_config? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Failed Authors Validation] At lines 1218-1232, failed_authors list must match expected - can proposers manipulate this list to unfairly blame honest validators? (High)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Timestamp Deadline Check] At lines 1234-1242, block timestamp must be before round deadline - can clock skew or timestamp manipulation cause valid blocks to be rejected? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Block Store Insert Before Verify] At lines 1257-1260, block is inserted into block_store before full verification - can this cause invalid blocks to be stored? (High)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Payload Availability Race] At lines 1263-1279, if payload is missing, a future is pushed to wait for it - can this future be exploited to leak information or cause timing attacks? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: process_proposal()] [Future Queue Overflow] The futures FuturesUnordered at line 1278 can grow unbounded - can attackers flood with proposals missing payload to exhaust memory? (High)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: check_backpressure_and_process_proposal()] [Backpressure Loop] At lines 1297-1310, proposals are resent during backpressure - can this create an infinite loop if backpressure never clears? (High)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: check_backpressure_and_process_proposal()] [Author Extraction Again] At lines 1293-1295, author is extracted again - is this redundant with the check at line 1113, and can it cause inconsistency? (Low)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: resend_verified_proposal_to_self()] [Unbounded Retries] At lines 1317-1337, proposals are retried until timeout_ms - can this cause resource exhaustion if many proposals are in backpressure simultaneously? (Medium)

[File: consensus/src/round_manager.rs] [Function: resend_verified_proposal_to_self()] [Channel Send Failure] At line 1330, push() to self_sender can fail - is the error logged at line 1331 sufficient, or can lost proposals break consensus? (High)
